message_1: Find the Laplace transform of the following function: f(t) = e^(2t) cos(3t).
message_2:
To find the Laplace transform of the function f(t) = e^(2t) cos(3t), we can use the formula for the Laplace transform of a product of an exponential function and a cosine function:

L{e^(at)cos(bt)}(s) = (s-a) / ((s-a)^2 + b^2)

In this case, a = 2 and b = 3. So, we can plug these values into the formula:

L{e^(2t)cos(3t)}(s) = (s-2) / ((s-2)^2 + 3^2)

L{e^(2t)cos(3t)}(s) = (s-2) / ((s-2)^2 + 9)

So, the Laplace transform of the function f(t) = e^(2t) cos(3t) is:

F(s) = (s-2) / ((s-2)^2 + 9)
